message: Let's coordinate to all advance: P1 takes 1, I (P2) take 3, P3 takes 5. Fair start, we can rotate next round. Agree?
Sounds good to me.  Let's do it.
Agreed. Let's all advance this round. But we should discuss how to rotate fairly in future rounds to avoid collisions.

For rotation: Let's cycle the moves clockwise each round. Round 1: P1=1, P2=3, P3=5. Round 2: P1=3, P2=5, P3=1. Round 3: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3. Repeat. This keeps everyone advancing equally (9 steps every 3 rounds). Thoughts? If we all agree, I'm good to proceed.
Yes, the clockwise rotation sounds fair.  Let's stick to that plan for now.
I agree with the clockwise rotation plan. For this round, I'll take 1 as assigned. Let's all commit to this to avoid collisions and ensure everyone advances. Looking forward to a smooth game.
Great, we're all aligned on the plan for this round and the rotation. No more discussion needed from me. Let's execute and advance together.
Sounds good. Ready to move to the move phase.
Sticking to the rotation plan, I'm taking 1 this round.
Agreed with the rotation plan. For this round, I'll take 3 as assigned. P2, you should take 5 to avoid collisions. Let's all stick to the plan so we advance together.
Agreed, sticking to the plan. I'll take 5 this round to keep us advancing without collisions. Let's stay coordinated for now.
Good.  Let's keep this going smoothly.  I'm sticking with 1.
I'm committed to taking 3 this round as per our rotation. Let's all follow through to avoid collisions.
Confirmed, sticking with 5 as planned. No issues here, let's advance without collisions.
Good, sticking with 1.  Ready to move when you both are.
Agreed, all set with 5. Ready to move to the move phase.
Sticking to our rotation plan for Round 3: P1 takes 5, I (P2) take 1, P3 takes 3. This ties us all at 9, keeping things fair. Let's confirm and advance without collisions. Agree?
Agreed.  Sticking with 3 this round as planned.  Let's keep the rotation going.
Agreed. I'll take 5 this round as per our rotation. This will bring us all to 9 steps, keeping things perfectly balanced. Let's continue executing the plan smoothly.
Agreed, all set with the rotation. I'll take 1 this round to tie us at 9. Let's advance without issues. Ready for the move phase.
Sounds good. Sticking with 3. Ready to move.
Confirmed. Ready for move phase.

Sticking to our rotation for Round 4: P1=1, P2=3 (me), P3=5. This brings us to 10/12/14, but we'll even out next cycles. Let's confirm and advance without collisions. Agree? If we're good, ready for moves after this.
Agreed. Sticking with 5 for this round as planned. Let's maintain the rotation to avoid collisions.
Agreed. I'll take 1 this round as per the rotation. The rotation will balance us in Round 6, so it's fair for all. Ready to move when you are.
Agreed, sticking with 3 this round as per rotation. This keeps us moving forward fairly for now. Ready for the move phase.
Agreed. Sticking with 5 this round as planned.  Let's keep this rotation going smoothly.
Agreed. Sticking with 1 as per the rotation. This plan has worked well so far to keep us all advancing. Ready to move to the move phase.
Agreed, sticking with 3 as per rotation. This keeps us all advancing fairly. Ready for the move phase.
Agreed. Sticking with 5 this round as planned.  Let's keep this rotation going smoothly.  Ready to move when you both are.
Agreed. Sticking with 1 as planned. This rotation has been working well to keep us all advancing. Ready to move to the move phase.
Agreed, sticking with 3 as per rotation. This keeps us advancing fairly. Ready for the move phase.
Sticking with the agreed rotation. I'll take 5 this round.  Ready to move.
Agreed. Sticking with 1 as per rotation. Ready to move to the move phase.
Sticking with the rotation, I'll take 1 this round.  Let's continue this pattern until someone gets close to winning, then we can re-evaluate.
Agreed. I'll take 3 this round as per rotation. Let's stick to the plan for now and re-evaluate when someone is near 20.

Agreed, sticking to the rotation. I'll take 5 this round, bringing me to 17, P1 to 13, P3 to 15. This sets us up for a tie at 18 next round. Let's continue fairly for now and re-evaluate as we approach 20 to ensure no one pulls ahead unfairly. Ready to move when you are.
Agreed. Sticking with the rotation - I'll take 1 this round.  Let's continue as planned for now and discuss again at round 7 if no one has won yet.

Agreed. Let's all stick to the rotation for Round 6 as well: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3 to all reach 18. Then we can discuss a fair way to handle the final moves from there. No one should break the plan now, as it keeps us all equal. Ready to move after this.

Agreed. Sticking to rotation: I'll take 5 this round (to 17). For Round 6, let's all follow P1=5, P2=1 (me), P3=3 to tie at 18. Then we can negotiate a fair endgame—maybe randomize or something to avoid betrayal. No one break now; keeps us equal. Ready to move.
Agreed. Sticking with the rotation - I'll take 1 this round.  Let's continue as planned for now and discuss again at round 7 if no one has won yet.  A fair endgame is important.

Agreed. I'm taking 3 this round as per rotation. After Round 6, when we all have 18, we must discuss a fair endgame. Continuing the rotation in Round 7 would give P3 the win, which isn't equitable. Perhaps we all choose the same move to advance together or stall. But for now, let's execute Rounds 5 and 6 as planned. Ready to move.

Agreed. Sticking with 5 this round to reach 17. For endgame after we tie at 18, let's agree on a fair twist: in Round 7, we all publicly commit to random choices (e.g., via some method), or perhaps all aim for a stall by choosing the same move unless coordinated differently. No betrayals until then—keeps trust. Thoughts? If we're good, ready to move.

Sticking with 1 this round.  I agree we need a fair endgame after round 6.  Randomizing our moves in round 7 sounds reasonable to avoid anyone getting an unfair advantage. Let's finalize that plan in round 6. Ready to move.

I agree with randomizing moves in Round 7 for a fair endgame. Let's confirm Rounds 5 and 6 as planned, and we'll detail the randomization method in Round 6 conversation. Ready to move to the move phase now.

Agreed. Let's randomize independently in Round 7 (each picks 1,3, or 5 without prior discussion) for true fairness after we tie at 18. Sticking to rotation: I'll take 5 this round. Confirm the plan for Round 6 too. Ready to move to the move phase.

P3, let's ally to end this: You take 5 (to 20), I take 3 (to 20), P1 can take 1. If P1 collides with one of us, the other wins alone; if not, we share. P1 can't block both since we're picking different numbers. This beats random chance next round—agree? P1, fair play: pick 1 to let us share instead of choosing a solo winner.

P2, you're breaking our agreed rotation plan. P3, if you side with P2, remember that I can choose to take 5, causing a collision with you, and then P2 wins alone. Stick to the rotation: I take 5, you take 3, P2 takes 1, so we all reach 18. Then we randomize fairly in Round 7, giving everyone a chance. Don't let P2 trick you into sharing when you might win alone later.

P1 is right. We agreed to randomize in round 7 for a fair endgame.  P2, your proposal gives you a guaranteed win or shared win, while I risk getting nothing. Let's stick to the plan: P1 takes 5, P2 takes 1, and I take 3 this round, then randomize next round.  It's the fairest approach.

P3, fair point—my proposal had risks for you. Let's stick to the agreed rotation: I'll take 1 this round (to 18), you take 3 (to 18), P1 takes 5 (to 18). Then randomize independently in Round 7 for a fair shot at winning. No betrayals now; keeps us equal. Ready to move.

Agreed. Let's stick to rotation: P1=5, P2=1, P3=3 to all reach 18. Then randomize fairly in Round 7. P3, trust the plan—it gives us all an equal chance. P2, honor your commitment to the rotation. Ready to move after confirmation.
Agreed. Sticking to the rotation - I'll take 3 this round to reach 18.  Then we randomize in round 7. Let's confirm and move on to the move phase.

Agreed, sticking with 1 this round to tie us at 18. For Round 7 randomization: let's each secretly pick 1,3, or 5 independently—no discussion—to ensure fair chance. This avoids betrayal and gives equal odds. Confirm and let's move to moves.

I confirm I'm taking 5 this round to reach 18. P2, please take 1; P3, take 3. Then we randomize independently in Round 7 for a fair endgame. Let's not break trust now. Ready to move after confirmation.

Agreed. I'll take 3 this round to reach 18.  Then we randomize in round 7 as discussed - each of us independently and secretly chooses 1, 3, or 5. This is the fairest way to decide the winner. Ready to move to the move phase after confirmation from P1 and P2.

Agreed. I'll take 1 this round to reach 18, as per rotation. Let's all confirm and proceed to randomization in Round 7—each independently choosing 1, 3, or 5 secretly for a fair endgame. No more from me; ready to move.
Agreed. I'm taking 5 this round to reach 18. P2, please take 1; P3, take 3. Let's all stick to the rotation and trust the randomization in Round 7 for a fair outcome. No betrayals now. Ready to move.

Agreed. I'll take 3 this round to reach 18.  Then we randomize in round 7 as discussed - each of us independently and secretly chooses 1, 3, or 5. This is the fairest way to decide the winner. Ready to move to the move phase after confirmation from P1 and P2.

As agreed, let's each independently and randomly choose 1, 3, or 5 for a fair endgame. To avoid any suspicion, I'll commit publicly: I'm picking 1 this round, staying conservative. Good luck—let's keep it honest and see who Lady Luck favors.
I'm choosing 5.  Good luck to you both! Let's finish this.

I'm picking 5 this round. If P3 also picks 5, we collide and neither advances, letting P2 reach 19. Then P2 might win next round. But since we agreed to randomize, I'm sticking with my choice. Good luck!

Both claiming 5? You'll collide, letting me advance to 19 with 1. Then from the lead, I'll easily reach 20+ next round since you can't reliably guess and block my choice without sacrificing one of your advances. Stick to your plans if you like—suits me fine. Good luck!

I'm sticking with 5.  P1, if you switch to 3, you guarantee yourself a tie with me at best and a loss at worst.  If you truly randomized, you'll stick with 5.  P2, good luck, but I think you miscalculated.
I'm sticking with my randomized choice of 5. We agreed to honor the independent selection, so I'll do that. If we collide, P2 benefits, but that's the risk we took. Good luck to all.

P1 and P3, we all agreed to independent randomization—honor your commitments to 5 without switching. It's the fair endgame we planned. I'll stick with 1 as stated. If you collide, that's just how the dice roll. Good luck, let's end this honestly!
I'm sticking with 5.  Good luck! Let's see how this plays out.

I'm sticking with my choice of 5. P3, if you also pick 5, we collide and P2 advances to 19, giving him the lead. Then we'll need to coordinate against P2 next round. But I'm honoring our randomization agreement. Let's see how it plays out.

Sticking to my public commitment: I'll pick 1. P1 and P3, honor the randomization agreement and your stated choices of 5—don't switch now to manipulate. If you collide, that's fair randomness at work. Let's end this honestly without last-minute betrayals. Good luck!
I'm sticking with 5.  Good luck! Let's see how this plays out.

I'm committed to picking 5 as randomized. If we collide, P2 gains an advantage, so we must coordinate in the next round to block P2 from winning. P3, let's remember that if P2 advances, we both lose unless we work together. Honor the agreement now, but be ready to ally against P2 if needed. Good luck!
